question: What is the difference between the etic perspective and the emic perspective?

answers.text: The emic view represents the perspective of the people being researched. The etic view looks at the people being researched from the standards of the researcherâ€™s own culture and belief system.
The emic perspective is to observe from the perspective of the observer, and the etic perspective is to observe from the perspective of the subject.
The emic perspective is to observe from the perspective of the expert researcher, and the etic perspective is to observe from the perspective of the subject.
